body_html:
So I don't know if this info is meant to be more visible, but I think you are meant to include more information when reporting a bug:

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE.md

I have also been getting strange behaviour with (scalar) multiplies, but this does not seem to be the same thing.

I could be wrong, but I think that those vectors are very nearly orthogonal, so you could just be getting rounding errors from the small dot product. One thing you could do is write some tests to see what context this happens in and try to rule out that possibility.

I could be wrong, but I think that those vectors are very nearly orthogonal, so you could just be getting rounding errors from the small dot product. One thing you could do is write some tests to see what context this happens in and try to rule out that possibility.
body:
So I don't know if this info is meant to be more visible, but I think you are meant to include more information when reporting a bug:

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE.md

I have also been getting strange behaviour with (scalar) multiplies, but this does not seem to be the same thing.

I could be wrong, but I think that those vectors are very nearly orthogonal, so you could just be getting rounding errors from the small dot product. One thing you could do is write some tests to see what context this happens in and try to rule out that possibility.
